intro: Monotropanthum ampullaceum, commonly known as the golden starflower, is a rare and unique plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble small stars, which bloom in late summer. The plant is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. It has a compact growth habit with woody stems and is often found in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species.
